main

Interface BetterClone<MetaType,Self extends BetterClone<MetaType,Self>>

  • Type Parameters:
    MetaType - the type of metadata. Even if it's a primitive, it has to be wrapped in an object.
    Self - itself. Hacky way of enforcing it.

    public interface BetterClone<MetaType,Self extends BetterClone<MetaType,Self>>
    Cloneable doesn't work. It's just plain terrible.
    This interface is meant to replace it.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    EPICI

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Self deepCopy(MetaType metaData)
      Do its best to copy everything
      Standard convention is if an object also implements BetterClone, then its deepCopy method is called if possible
      If metaData is null (likely because a user didn't know) and an object is expected, use some form of default
      Self shallowCopy(MetaType metaData)
      Shallow copy, generally returns a different object with copied fields
      If metaData is null (likely because a user didn't know) and an object is expected, use some form of default

    • Method Detail

      • shallowCopy

        Self shallowCopy(MetaType metaData)
        Shallow copy, generally returns a different object with copied fields
        If metaData is null (likely because a user didn't know) and an object is expected, use some form of default
        Parameters:
        metaData - metadata which can influence how it's cloned
        Returns:
        a shallow copy

      • deepCopy

        Self deepCopy(MetaType metaData)
        Do its best to copy everything
        Standard convention is if an object also implements BetterClone, then its deepCopy method is called if possible
        If metaData is null (likely because a user didn't know) and an object is expected, use some form of default
        Parameters:
        metaData - metadata which can influence how it's cloned
        Returns:
        a deep copy
